text: hello this is Bill Cunningham reporting
from the first truly spring week in New
York and of course human nature is the
first thing is to take off the winter
coat and that's what we saw this week
and it's what made it very very special
the brightest sign was the galvanized
puppet of multiple tulips in the Union
Square farmers market the fashion people
took off their coats all the parks were
filled on Thursday and Wednesday with
people just taking in the first truly
strong spring day the Scottish parade
the thriftless parade in the city I
think it passed in 20 minutes in the 10
blocks on 6th Avenue but it's wonderful
it's so homegrown it's just absolutely
wonderful
Cotton's Scottish tweed men jackets it's
fun isn't it the little girl with a
Scottie dog in the tartan all over the
city the planting urns on the street
exploding with tulips daffodils and blue
hyacinth just absolutely marvelous and
add to that this year a spectacular
public art display of Faberge like eggs
250 eggs painted by artists that are
being displayed in public spaces there
are 20 of them in Rockefeller Center and
they will all be auctioned on April of
22nd to benefit to groups out of London
the save the elephant family a global
conservation organization headed by
Marchand and in New York it'll benefit
studio in the school an arts education
group headed by egg
is good it wonderful objects and you
can't miss them all together it made for
a marvelous really wonderful explosion
of spring and just gave everyone hope
after a rather long winter enjoy it is
as they say life renewed
Oh
